function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Potential spread of SARS-CoV-2 through sewage contamination and wastewater","Impact":"Uncontrolled spread of the virus in the population, leading to increased infection rates","Mitigation":"Implementation of effective sewage treatment and disinfection methods to eliminate the virus","Technologies":"Advanced sewage treatment systems, UV disinfection, chlorination","People":"General population in areas served by the sewage system","Owner":"Local government, sewage treatment authorities"},{"Description":"Relying on molecular methods for quantifying virus concentration in raw sewage","Impact":"Inaccurate estimation of the total number of individuals excreting the virus, leading to flawed epidemiological analysis","Mitigation":"Validation of molecular methods against known standards, regular calibration, and quality control procedures","Technologies":"Standardized molecular testing protocols, quality assurance and quality control measures","People":"Research institutions, laboratories conducting sewage analysis","Owner":"Public health authorities, regulatory bodies"},{"Description":"Comparison of wastewater surveillance data with clinical data","Impact":"Discrepancies between wastewater-based epidemiology (WBE) and clinical data, leading to misinterpretation of virus circulation and trends","Mitigation":"Integration of wastewater and clinical data, validation of WBE findings against clinical evidence","Technologies":"Data analysis and integration tools, interdisciplinary collaboration between epidemiologists and environmental scientists","People":"Public health officials, epidemiologists, environmental scientists","Owner":"National health institutes, public health agencies"}]}
